Attribute description.0: An alternative name for this item.

Attribute description.23: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.
Attribute description.25: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.
Attribute description.26: The size of the accommodation, e.g. in square meter or squarefoot. Typical unit code(s): MTK for square meter, FTK for square foot, or YDK for square yard.
Attribute description.27: The year an Accommodation was constructed.
Attribute description.28: a city or town with its own local government,
Attribute description.29: an administrative division within a country or state.
Attribute description.30: a number that serves to identify real estate
Attribute description.38: The distance around a two dimensional shape
Attribute description.45: A sensor is a device that measures a physical quantity and converts it into a signal which can be read by an observer or by an instrument

Attribute description.1: Thermal transmittance of window
Attribute description.2: The radiation gain of solar

Attribute description.1: An alternative name for this item
Attribute description.2: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided
Attribute description.3: Device battery level. It must be equal to 1.0 when battery is full. 0.0 when battery is empty. -1 when transiently cannot be determined.
Attribute description.4: Enum:'actuator, beacon, endgun, HVAC, implement, irrSection, irrSystem, meter, multimedia, network, sensor'
Attribute description.5: Device's technical configuration. This attribute is intended to be a array properties and their values which capture parameters which have to do with the configuration of a device (timeouts, reporting periods, etc.) and which are not currently covered by the standard attributes defined by this model.
Attribute description.6: Device's technical configuration. This attribute is intended to be a array properties and their values which capture parameters which have to do with the configuration of a device (timeouts, reporting periods, etc.) and which are not currently covered by the standard attributes defined by this model.
Attribute description.7: Anything that can be sensed, measured or controlled by.
Attribute description.8: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.
Attribute description.9: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.
Attribute description.10: A timestamp which denotes when the device was first used.
Attribute description.11: A timestamp which denotes when the device was installed (if it requires installation).
Attribute description.12: A timestamp which denotes when the last calibration of the device happened.
Attribute description.13: A timestamp which denotes the last time when the device successfully reported data to the cloud.
Attribute description.14: A timestamp which denotes when the device was manufactured.
Attribute description.15: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.
Attribute description.16: Date of the observed entity defined by the user.
Attribute description.17: Location of this device represented by a depth from a starting point. All units are accepted in CEFACT code
Attribute description.19: State of this device from an operational point of view. Its value can be vendor dependent.
Attribute description.21: Location of this device represented by a distance from a starting point. All units are accepted in CEFACT code
Attribute description.22: Indicates a device which is Daylight Savings Time Aware (True).
Attribute description.23: The firmware version of this device.
Attribute description.24: The hardware version of this device.
Attribute description.26: List of IP address of the device. It can be a comma separated list of values if the device has more than one IP address.
Attribute description.27: Geojson reference to the item. It can be Point, LineString, Polygon, MultiPoint, MultiLineString or MultiPolygon.
Attribute description.28: The MAC address of the device.
Attribute description.29: This property identifies the Mobile Country Code.
Attribute description.30: This property identifies the Mobile Network Code (MNC) of the network the device is attached to. The MNC is used in combination with a Mobile Country Code (MCC) (also known as a 'MCC / MNC tuple') to uniquely identify a mobile phone operator/carrier using the GSM, CDMA, iDEN, TETRA and 3G / 4G public land mobile networks and some satellite mobile networks.
Attribute description.32: The version of the host operating system device.
Attribute description.33: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s).
Attribute description.36: Location of this device in a coordinate system according to its local emplacement.
Attribute description.37: Received signal strength indicator for a wireless enabled device. It must be expressed in dBm or mW, use unitcode to set it out.
Attribute description.38: list of uri pointing to additional resources about the item.
Attribute description.39: The serial number assigned by the manufacturer.
Attribute description.40: The software version of this device.
Attribute description.41: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL.
Attribute description.43: NGSI Entity type. It has to be Device
Attribute description.44: A observed or reported value. For actuator devices, it is an attribute that allows a controlling application to change the actuation setting.
Attribute description.45:
Enumeration defining the energy source or fuel cumbusted to generate heat.
The source of energy.
Attribute description.46: Nominal capacity. Usually measured in Watts (W, J/s)
Attribute description.49: A heat exchanger is a device used to provide heat transfer between non-mixing media such as plate and shell and tube heat exchangers. HeatExchanger is commonly used on water-side distribution systems to recover energy from a liquid to another liquid

Attribute description.0: aximum mechanics Pressure (shear, elasticity, compression) load on a Panel. The format is structured by a sub-property of 3 items.
Attribute description.1: Maximum system voltage permitted for the module.
Attribute description.2: Nominal Power for the panel.
Attribute description.3: Number of 'Modules' per 'Panel'.
Attribute description.4: The mailing address.
Attribute description.5: An alternative name for this item.
Attribute description.6: Target application regarding the Type of Solar panel (In our case electric).
Attribute description.7: Evaluation of the potential hazards associated with the module.
Attribute description.8: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.
Attribute description.9: Area Weight measured in Kg/m².
Attribute description.10: Brand Name of the item.
Attribute description.11: External dimension of a cell. The format is structured by a sub-property of 3 items.
Attribute description.12: This is the nominal operating temperature range of the cells in which it collects solar energy. The format is structured by a sub-property of 2 items.
Attribute description.13: Type of cells used to built the photo-voltaic unit.
Attribute description.14: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.
Attribute description.15: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.
Attribute description.16: A timestamps which denotes the last time when the device successfully reported data.
Attribute description.17: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.
Attribute description.20: Evaluation to the fire (IEC 61730). A unique value.
Attribute description.22: Condition and possibility of use in the following environments.
Attribute description.23: Positioning of the device in relation to a ground reference system.
Attribute description.24: Geojson reference to the item. It can be Point, LineString, Polygon, MultiPoint, MultiLineString or MultiPolygon.
Attribute description.27: External dimension of a module. A module can be an assembly of 1 to n cells. The format is structured by a sub-property of 3 items.
Attribute description.28: Normal Operating Cell Temperature measurements. The format is structured by a sub-property of 5 items.
Attribute description.31: Positioning of the device in relation to a ground reference system.
Attribute description.32: The Negative Temperature Coefficient of resistance - NTC, describes the relative change of a physical property that is associated with a given change in negative temperature.
Attribute description.34: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s).
Attribute description.35: The Positive Temperature Coefficient of resistance - PTC, describes the relative change of a physical property that is associated with a given change in positive temperature.
Attribute description.36: External dimension of a Panel. A solar panel can be an assembly of 1 to n modules, which themselves are made of several cells which collect heat from the sun's rays. The format is structured by a sub-property of 3 items.
Attribute description.38: Ambient operating temperature range. This is the minimum and maximum resistance to cold and heat for using the panel. The format is structured by a sub-property of 2 items.
Attribute description.39: Weight of a panel (Sometime the reference used is Kg / m²).
Attribute description.40: Energy production yield curve of the panel from its [NominalPower] at [T0] and along its [panelLifetime]. The Measurements provided in the list are a sequence of Energy Production Capacity represented in Percent starting at 5 years with a 'Step' of 5 years according to the information provided by the manufacturer.
Attribute description.41: Average relative yield to Performance at Low Irradiance.
Attribute description.43: IP 'Ingress Protection' for the Junction Box. This is the level classifies and rates the degree of protection provided by mechanical casings and electrical enclosures against intrusion, dust, accidental contact, and water according to International Electrotechnical Commission standard (EN 60-529).
Attribute description.44: Reference to the Main Entity Device if used as second link.
Attribute description.45: Reference to a PointOfInterest linked with the Repository.
Attribute description.46: list of uri pointing to additional resources about the item.
Attribute description.47: List of serial numbers of Photo-voltaic device supplied by the manufacturer and assembled in operating mode on a single location.
Attribute description.48: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL.
Attribute description.49: Temperature influence coefficient on the panel. The format is structured by a sub-property of 3 items.
Attribute description.50: NGSI Entity type. It has to be PhotovoltaicDevice.
Attribute description.51: Accepted use regarding its positioning in an indoor / outdoor environment.
Attribute description.52: A relationship specifying the purpose for which a device is used for

Attribute description.1: It has to be SmartMeteringObservation. NGSI entity type
Attribute description.2: The mailing address
Attribute description.3: An alternative name for this item
Attribute description.4: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided
Attribute description.5: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.
Attribute description.6: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.
Attribute description.7: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.
Attribute description.8: A description of this item
Attribute description.9: The entity specification version. A version number of 2.0 or later denotes the entity is represented using NGSI-LD
Attribute description.10: An image of the item
Attribute description.11: Geojson reference to the item. It can be Point, LineString, Polygon, MultiPoint, MultiLineString or MultiPolygon
Attribute description.12: The type of supply being metered e.g.: Electricity, Gasoline, Water, Methane, Diesel.
Attribute description.13: The name of this item.
Attribute description.14: The total amount of product supplied during 'off-peak' hours (particularly relevant to Electricity supply) as recorded by the meter since installation. The relevant unitCode should be specified such as KWH (Kilo Watt Hours) for Electricity, LTR (Litre) or MTQ (Cubic Metre) for gases or liquids.
Attribute description.15: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
Attribute description.16: The total amount of product supplied during 'peak' hours (particularly relevant to Electricity supply) as recorded by the meter since installation. The relevant unitCode should be specified such as KWH (Kilo Watt Hours) for Electricity, LTR (Litre) or MTQ (Cubic Metre) for gases or liquids.
Attribute description.17: Relevant to 3-Phase electricity supplies often used in industry - the power factor ranges from -1 to +1 depending on the net balance between capacitive and inductive loads. If used this measures the average power factor since meter installation.
Attribute description.19: list of uri pointing to additional resources about the item
Attribute description.20: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.
Attribute description.21: The total amount of product supplied as recorded by the meter since installation. The relevant unitCode should be specified such as KWH (Kilo Watt Hours) for Electricity, LTR (Litre) or MTQ (Cubic Metre) for gases or liquids
Attribute description.22: Date of the observed entity defined by the user.
Attribute description.23: Device battery level. It must be equal to 1.0 when battery is full. 0.0 when battery is empty. -1 when transiently cannot be determined.

Attribute description.1: NGSI Entity type. It has to be PhotovoltaicMeasurement
Attribute description.2: Date of the observed entity defined by the user.
Attribute description.4: Temperature recorded at the time of Observation compared to the nominal reference temperature of the device. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, CEL represents Degree Celsius
Attribute description.5: Active Power,where phi is the phase shift of the current compared to the voltage. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes (max 3 characters). For instance, For instance, KWT represents Kilowatt
Attribute description.6: The mailing address
Attribute description.7: An alternative name for this item
Attribute description.8: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided
Attribute description.9: Electrical intensity of the current. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, AMP represents Ampere
Attribute description.10: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.
Attribute description.11: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.
Attribute description.12: The starting date for metering energy in an ISO8601 UTC format
Attribute description.13: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.
Attribute description.14: Observation period: Start date and time in an ISO8601 UTC format. The attribute can be used in addition to the 'dateObserved attribute when it corresponds to a time interval to be highlighted
Attribute description.15: Observation period: End date and time in an ISO8601 UTC format. The attribute can be used in addition to the 'dateObserved' attribute when it corresponds to a time interval to be highlighted
Attribute description.17: Active Power,where phi is the phase shift of the current compared to the voltage. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes (max 3 characters). For instance, For instance, KWT represents Kilowatt. Enum:'00-On sector, 01-Power failure / On battery, 02-Loss of communication, 03-Battery fault, 04-System shutdown, 05-Tension dip, 06-Overvoltage, 07-Voltage drop, 08-Voltage increase, 09-Line noise, 10-Frequency variation, 11-Transient distortion, 12-Harmonic distortion'
Attribute description.18: Geojson reference to the item. It can be Point, LineString, Polygon, MultiPoint, MultiLineString or MultiPolygon
Attribute description.20: nominalPeakPowerGeneration is a number. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, KWT represents Kilowatt
Attribute description.21: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
Attribute description.22: Reactive Power used by circuits. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, K5 represents kilovolt-ampere-reactive
Attribute description.23: Reference to a PointOfInterest linked with the Repository.
Attribute description.24: list of uri pointing to additional resources about the item
Attribute description.25: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

Attribute description.0: Active Power, where 'phi' is the phase shift of the current compared to the voltage. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, KWT represents Kilowatt
Attribute description.1: The mailing address
Attribute description.2: An alternative name for this item
Attribute description.3: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided
Attribute description.4: Assessment and calculation methods for measurements assessing the condition of the battery. Enum:'ampereHourMetry, dischargeTest, electrolyteDensity, highFrequencyImpedance, lowFrequencyImpedance, mathematicalModel, operatingVoltageWithClosedCircuit, quiescentVoltageWithOpenCircuit'
Attribute description.5: Device's battery level. A unique value of the following value 0.0=battery empty, 1.0=Battery full, -1.0=Transiently not determined.
Attribute description.6: Status of the battery during the measurement( giving or not energy). Enum:'consumingEnergy, givingEnergy, standby'
Attribute description.7: Current. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, AMP represents Ampere.
Attribute description.8: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.
Attribute description.9: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.
Attribute description.10: The starting date for metering energy in an ISO8601 UTC format
Attribute description.11: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.
Attribute description.12: Observation period: Start date and time in an ISO8601 UTC format. The attribute can be used in addition to the 'dateObserved' attribute when it corresponds to a time interval to be highlighted.
Attribute description.13: Observation period: End date and time in an ISO8601 UTC format. The attribute can be used in addition to the 'dateObserved' attribute when it corresponds to a time interval to be highlighted.
Attribute description.14: The Deep of Discharge (Code DoD) expressed in % is the ratio between the capacity already discharged and the nominal capacity of the accumulator. That is to say the energy consumed in the battery. Rule  [DOD] = 100 % - [SOC]. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, P1 represents Percent
Attribute description.15: A description of this item
Attribute description.17: Status of the inverter. A combination of values. Enum:'00-Onsector, 01-PowerFailure/OnBattery, 02-LossCommunication, 03-BatteryFault, 04-SystemShutDown, 05-TensionDip, 06-OverVoltage, 07-VoltageDrop, 08-VoltageIncrease, 09-LineNoise, 10-FrequencyVariation, 11-TransientDistortion, 12-HarmonicDistortion'
Attribute description.18: Geojson reference to the item. It can be Point, LineString, Polygon, MultiPoint, MultiLineString or MultiPolygon
Attribute description.20: The Open Circuit Voltage (Code OCV) expressed in Volt is the difference of electrical potential between two terminals of a device when disconnected from any circuit. There is no external load connected and No external electric current flows between the terminals. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, VLT represents Volt
Attribute description.21: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
Attribute description.22: Reactive Power used by circuits. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, K5 represents kilovolt-ampere-reactive
Attribute description.23: Reference to a PointOfInterest linked with the Repository.
Attribute description.24: Reference to a Storage Battery Device which captured this observation, if the entity is used.
Attribute description.25: list of uri pointing to additional resources about the item
Attribute description.26: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.
Attribute description.27: The State of Charge (Code SoC) expressed in % is defined as the ratio between the remaining and the current capacities. The current capacity is the maximum capacity that can be withdrawn from the fully charged battery under specific discharge conditions. Rule [SOC] + [DOD] = 100 %. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, P1 represents Percent
Attribute description.28: The State of Health  (Code SoH) expressed in % is defined as the ratio between the maximum amount of charge that a fully charged battery can provide under its nominal discharge regime, and its nominal capacity. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, P1 represents Percent
Attribute description.29: Main Temperature recorded at the time of Observation compared to the  nominal reference temperature of the device. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, CEL represents Degree Celsius
Attribute description.30: NGSI Entity type. It has to be StorageBatteryMeasurement

Attribute description.1: Enum:'electricMobility, energyStorage, emergencyStorage, houseHoldStorage, industrialStorage, lighting, production, robotics, other'. Target application of the Device regarding the storage. A combination of the enumeration.
Attribute description.2: An alternative name for this item
Attribute description.3: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided
Attribute description.4: average life under normal battery usage conditions at reference temperatures. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, ANN represents Year
Attribute description.5: Enum:'ampereHourMeter, dischargeTest, electrolyteDensity, highFrequencyImpedance, lowFrequencyImpedance, mathematicalModel, operatingVoltageWithClosedCircuit, quiescentVoltageWithOpenCircuit'.
Attribute description.6: Enum:'alkaline, gel, lead, lead-AGM, Li-Ion, Li-Po, Li-Po4, LMP, Li-Air, Na-NiCl2(Zebra), Ni-Cd, Ni-MH, Ni-Zn, other'. Type of battery used.
Attribute description.7: Brand Name of the item.
Attribute description.8: Remaining energy as a function of the discharge time for 6 keys according the temperature of reference. Each Key is a structured value with the format {Cnnn:[value1,value2]} describing the different measurement of [CapacityCnnn].
Attribute description.9: Charge and Discharge Reactivity which characterizes the reactive behavior of the system. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, SEC represents Second
Attribute description.10: Charge Efficiency (code PV-BAT). The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, P1 represents Percent.
Attribute description.11: Load Power. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, VLT represents Volt
Attribute description.12: Charging mode permitted to avoid damage to the battery. enum:'fast, normal, quick'
Attribute description.13: List of communication protocol with others device depending manufacturers. Enum:'CAN 2.0 B, dryContactTerminal, maintenanceInterface, RS485, RS485BMS, RS485Inverter, other'
Attribute description.14: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.
Attribute description.15: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.
Attribute description.16: A timestamp which denotes the last time when the device successfully reported data. Date and time in an ISO8601 UTCformat.
Attribute description.17: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.
Attribute description.19: External dimension of a Panel. The format is structured by a sub-property of 3 items. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, CMT represents Centimeter
Attribute description.20: Discharge Efficiency (code PV-OND). The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, P1 represents Percent.
Attribute description.21: Discharge Power. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, VLT represents Volt
Attribute description.23: Reference Time recorded for the attribute [peakPower]. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, SEC represents Second
Attribute description.25: Enum:'desert, dust, extremeClimate, extremeCold, extremeHeat, extremeHumidity, marine, saline, sand, seismic, other'. Condition and possibility of use in the following environments.
Attribute description.26: Enum:'aerial, ground, pole, roofing, underGround, wall, other'. Positioning of the device in relation to a ground reference system.
Attribute description.27: Number of admissible charge / discharge life cycles. The format is structured by a sub-property of 2 items.
Attribute description.28: Geojson reference to the item. It can be Point, LineString, Polygon, MultiPoint, MultiLineString or MultiPolygon
Attribute description.30: Mass Energy density (Code D). Ratio between the capacity of the battery to deliver a certain power for a certain time and its weight. The format is structured by a sub-property of 2 items. The unit code (text) of measurement is Wh/Kg WattHour per Kilogram
Attribute description.31: Maximum Power. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, KWT represents Kilowatt
Attribute description.32: Maximum authorized voltage after end of charge and Battery still connected to to a charge generator. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, VLT represents Volt
Attribute description.33: Minimum voltage after end of discharge and not connected to to a charge generator. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, VLT represents Volt
Attribute description.36: Nominal Amperage. (Code I). The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, AMP represents Ampere
Attribute description.37: Nominal Energy capacity. (Code C) to link with the attribute [CapacityCnnn] to measure the predefined levels parameters C / xx h of discharge regimes. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, AMH represents Ampere Hour
Attribute description.38: Nominal Frequency. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, HTZ represents Hertz
Attribute description.39: Nominal battery voltage. (Code U) The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, VLT represents Volt
Attribute description.40: Operating altitude with minimum and maximum resistance to height and depth. The format is structured by a sub-property of 2 items with the keys [min] =<0 and [max] >=0. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, MTR represents Meter
Attribute description.41: Minimum and Maximum Ampere allowed. The format is structured by a sub-property of 2 items. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, AMP represents Ampere
Attribute description.42: Minimum and Maximum frequency allowed. The format is structured by a sub-property of 2 items. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, HTZ represents Hertz
Attribute description.43: Ambient operating temperature range. This is the minimum and maximum resistance to cold and heat for an [event]. The format is structured by a sub-property of 3 items with the format {event:[min,max]}. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, CEL represents Degree Celsius
Attribute description.44: Minimum and Maximum voltage allowed. The format is structured by a sub-property of 2 items. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, VLT represents Volt
Attribute description.45: Overload is permitted after exceeding the threshold.(true for yes)
Attribute description.46: Accepted overcharge time without damage to the battery.
Attribute description.47: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
Attribute description.48: Maximum intensity extractable over a short period. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, KWT represents Kilowatt
Attribute description.49: Possibility of use. A unique value. Enum:'mobile, mixed, stationary, other'.
Attribute description.50: IK 'Mecanic Protection' level relating to numeric classification for the degrees of protection provided by enclosures for electrical equipment against external mechanical impacts, according to International Electro technical Commission standard (EN 62-262). - IK varies from 0 (minimum resistance) to 10 (maximum resistance) which represents an Impact Energy (Unit Joule)
Attribute description.51: IP Ingress Protection for the Junction Box. This is the level classifies and rates the degree of protection provided by mechanical casings and electrical enclosures against intrusion, dust, accidental contact, and water according to International Electrotechnical Commission standard (EN 60-529). - First digit: Solid particle protection (Single numeral: 0–6 or 'X'). - Second digit: Liquid ingress protection (Single numeral: 0–9 or 'X'). - Third digit: Personal Protection against access to dangerous parts (optional additional letter). - Fourth digit: Other protections (optional additional letter)
Attribute description.52: Enum:'electric, hydraulic, windTurbine, other'. Recharge Energy Source. A unique value of the list
Attribute description.53: Reference to the Main Entity Device if used as second link.
Attribute description.54: Reference to a PointOfInterest linked with the observation.
Attribute description.55: Round-Trip Efficiency. Efficiency, defined as the ratio between stored energy and returned energy. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, P1 represents Percent.
Attribute description.56: seeAlso: list of uri pointing to additional resources about the item
Attribute description.57: Battery discharge rate without any use on a baseline of 1 month according the [temperature of reference]. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, P1 represents Percentage.
Attribute description.59: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.
Attribute description.60: Total Storage Energy = [nominalVoltage] * [nominalCapacity]. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, KWH represents Kilowatt Hour
Attribute description.61: Use of a Battery Management System tool to protect, guarantee and optimize battery life. (true for yes)
Attribute description.63: Enum:'dam, fall, generator, network, photovoltaic, river, sea, waterTurbine, wind, other'. Type of Energy Source regarding RechargeEnergySource attribute.
Attribute description.64: Accepted use regarding its positioning in an indoor / outdoor environment. Enum:' indoor, mixed, outdoor, other'
Attribute description.65: Usable Energy. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, KWH represents Kilowatt Hour
Attribute description.66: Volume Energy density (Code D). The format is structured by a sub-property of 2 items. The unit code (text) of measurement is Wh/L WattHour per Liter
Attribute description.67: Weight. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes. For instance, KGM represents KiloGramme

Attribute description.8: The label of cooling demand, enum: A, B, C, D, E, F, G.

Attribute description.0: Type(s) of charge when using this station.

Attribute description.18: Opening hours of the charging station.

Attribute description.22: The total number of sockets offered by this charging station.
Attribute description.23: The type of sockets offered by this station.
Attribute description.24: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL.

Attribute description.27: The total voltage offered by the charging station.
Attribute description.29: A category that includes devices as described by building related data models, such as IFC and FIEMSER
Attribute description.32: Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a power unit
Attribute description.33: The unit of measure for power.

Attribute description.0: Active energy exported per phase. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.1: Active energy imported i.e. consumed per phase. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.2: Active power consumed per phase. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.3: The mailing address
Attribute description.4: An alternative name for this item
Attribute description.5: Apparent energy exported per phase. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.6: Apparent energy imported i.e. consumed per phase. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.7: Apparent power consumed per phase. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.8: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided
Attribute description.9: Electrical current. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.10: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.
Attribute description.11: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.
Attribute description.12: The starting date for metering energy in an ISO8601 UTC format.
Attribute description.13: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.
Attribute description.14: Date and time of this observation represented by an ISO8601 UTC format. It can be represented by an specific time instant or by an ISO8601 interval to separate attributes dateObservedFrom,dateObservedTo.
Attribute description.15: Observation period: Start date and time in an ISO8601 UTC format. The attribute can be used in addition to the dateObserved attribute when it corresponds to a time interval to be highlighted.
Attribute description.16: Observation period: End date and time in an ISO8601 UTC format. The attribute can be used in addition to the dateObserved attribute when it corresponds to a time interval to be highlighted.
Attribute description.17: Observation period: Start date and time in an ISO8601 UTC format. The attribute can be used in addition to the dateObserved attribute when it corresponds to a time interval to be highlighted.
Attribute description.18: Observation period: End date and time in an ISO8601 UTC format. The attribute can be used in addition to the dateObserved attribute when it corresponds to a time interval to be highlighted.
Attribute description.20: Displacement power factor for each phase. The quantity is based on the fundamental frequency of the system.
Attribute description.21: The frequency of the circuit. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.23: Geojson reference to the item. It can be Point, LineString, Polygon, MultiPoint, MultiLineString or MultiPolygon
Attribute description.25: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
Attribute description.26: Voltage between phases. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.27: Type of Phase. A unique value. Enum:'singlePhase, threePhase'
Attribute description.28: The voltage between each phase and neutral conductor. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.30: Fundamental frequency reactive energy exported per phase. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.31: Fundamental frequency reactive energy imported i.e. consumed per phase. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.32: Fundamental frequency reactive power. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.33: Reference to the devices which captured this observation
Attribute description.34: Reference to a list of the devices for which the measurement was taken
Attribute description.35: list of uri pointing to additional resources about the item
Attribute description.36: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.
Attribute description.37: Total harmonic distortion of current for each phase.
Attribute description.38: Total harmonic distortion of voltage for each phase.
Attribute description.39: Total energy imported i.e. consumed . The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.40: Total energy imported i.e. consumed. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.41: Total Active Power consumed. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.42: Total energy exported (with regards to apparent power). The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.43: Total energy imported i.e. consumed (with regards to apparent power). The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.44: Total Apparent Power consumed. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.45: Sum of Displacement power factor including all phases. The quantity is based on the fundamental frequency of the system.
Attribute description.46: Sum of Power factor including all phases.
Attribute description.47: Total fundamental frequency reactive energy exported. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.48: Total energy imported i.e. consumed (with regards to fundamental frequency reactive power). The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.49: Total Reactive Power consumed. The unit code (text) is given using the UN/CEFACT Common Codes
Attribute description.50: NGSI property type. It has to be ACMeasurement

Attribute description.1: An alternative name for this item
Attribute description.2: Target application of the Device regarding the environment. A combination of these values. Enum:'commercial, distributionService, industrial, other, publicWorks, road, tertiary, urbanService'
Attribute description.3: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided
Attribute description.4: Name of the brand
Attribute description.5: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

Attribute description.7: A timestamp which denotes the last time when the device successfully reported data. Date and time in an ISO8601 UTCformat
Attribute description.8: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.
Attribute description.9: A description of this item
Attribute description.10: Design materials to build the cabinet. A combination of  these values. Enum:'ABS-Plastic, aluminum, fiberGlass, galvanizedSteel, other, polyester, stainlessSteel'
Attribute description.11: The format is structured by a sub-property of 3 items. The unit code (text) of measurement  is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **CMT** represents Centimeter.
Attribute description.13: Door closing mode. A unique value of these values. Enum:'fixedHandle, other, revolvingHandle, triangleHandle'
Attribute description.14: Count of doors of the technical Cabinet.
Attribute description.15: Door opening angle expressed in decimal degrees with a range from 0 to 180 degree. The unit code (text) of measurement  is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **DD** represents Decimal Degrees.
Attribute description.16: Type of door of the technical Cabinet. A unique value of these values. Enum:'mixed, other, solid, transparent'
Attribute description.17: Interior Coating. A combination of these values. Enum:'fiberGlass, other, plastic, polyester, polyesterResin, steel
Attribute description.18: Exterior finish. A combination of these values. Enum:'graffiti, other, raised, roughcast, smooth, textured'
Attribute description.20: Condition and possibility of use in the following environments. A combination of these values. Enum:'desert, dust, extremeCold, extremeClimate, extremeHeat, extremeHumidity, marine, none, other, saline, seismic, sand'
Attribute description.21: Positioning of the device in relation to a ground reference system. Enum:'aerial, ground, other, pole, roofing, underground, wall'
Attribute description.22: Interior Coating. A combination of these values. Enum:'fiberGlass, heatInsulating, other, plastic, polyester, polyesterResin, steel'
Attribute description.23: Internal dimension corresponding to the place to work inside the technical cabinet. The format is structured by a sub-property of 3 items. The unit code (text) of measurement  is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **CMT** represents Centimeter
Attribute description.24: Geojson reference to the item. It can be Point, LineString, Polygon, MultiPoint, MultiLineString or MultiPolygon
Attribute description.26: Maximum system voltage permitted for the **module**. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes). For instance, **VLT** represents Volt
Attribute description.27: Name of the model as given by the manufacturer.
Attribute description.29: Ambient operating temperature range. This is the minimum and maximum resistance to cold and heat. The format is structured by a sub-property of 2 items. The unit code (text) is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes).
Attribute description.30: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
Attribute description.31: Possibility of use. A unique value. Enum:'mixed, mobile, other, stationary'
Attribute description.32: IK '*Mecanic Protection*' level relating to numeric classification for the degrees of protection provided by enclosures for electrical equipment against external mechanical impacts, according to International Electro technical Commission standard (EN 62-262). - IK varies from 0 (minimum resistance) to 10 (maximum resistance) which represents an Impact Energy (Unit Joule)
Attribute description.33: IP 'Ingress Protection' for the Junction Box. This is the level classifies and rates the degree of protection provided by mechanical casings and electrical enclosures against intrusion, dust, accidental contact, and water according to International Electrotechnical Commission standard (EN 60-529). First digit: Solid particle protection (Single numeral: 06 or 'X'). Second digit: Liquid ingress protection (Single numeral: 09 or 'X' ).Third digit: Personal Protection against access to dangerous parts (optional additional letter). Fourth digit: Other protections (optional additional letter)
Attribute description.34: Others protection of the technical cabinet. A combination of these values. Enum:'abrasion, basement, dampProof, display, doorTearing, dust, forcedOpening, graffiti, insect, other, roofOverload, saltSpray, shielding, solar, vandalism, water'
Attribute description.35: The device used to obtain the data expressed by this record

Attribute description.42: Accepted use regarding its positioning in an indoor / outdoor environment. A unique value of these values. Enum:'indoor, mixed, outdoor, other'
Attribute description.43: Ventilation mode. A combination of these values. Enum:'airConditioners, dehumidifier, none, other, selfVentilatedGills'
Attribute description.44: Weight of the item. The unit code (text) of measurement  is given using the [UN/CEFACT Common Codes](http://wiki.goodrelations-vocabulary.org/Documentation/UN/CEFACT_Common_Codes).

Attribute description.44: Over voltage category. - I : connection to circuits with transient over voltages at an appropriate low level. - II : main insulation and additional insulation (earth terminal). - III : fixed installations with reliability and availability making subject to specific specifications. - IV : materials at the origin of the electrical installation such as electric meters and main materials over current protection.

Attribute description.0: The actual values will beconveyed by subproperties which names will be equal to the name of each of the alternating current phases: L1, L2, L3.
Attribute description.1: The mailing address
Attribute description.2: An alternative name for this item
Attribute description.3: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided
Attribute description.4: Electrical current. The actual values will be conveyed by one subproperty per alternating current phase and the neutral wire: L1, L2, L3 and N.
Attribute description.5: URI pointing to the data-descriptor entity
Attribute description.6: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.
Attribute description.7: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.
Attribute description.8: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.
Attribute description.9: A description of this item
Attribute description.10: Energy generated over a specific time range from the energy resource corresponding to this observation.
Attribute description.11: Frequency observed from the entity corresponding to this observation.
Attribute description.13: Geojson reference to the item. It can be Point, LineString, Polygon, MultiPoint, MultiLineString or MultiPolygon
Attribute description.14: A measure of maximum solar energy that can be generated.
Attribute description.15: The name of this item.
Attribute description.17: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)
Attribute description.18: Current per phase. Ordered triple comprising of active power from three phases in the following order: [R Y B]
Attribute description.19: The voltage between each phase and neutral conductor. The actual values will be conveyed by one subproperty per alternating current phase: L1, L2 and L3
Attribute description.20: Power factor for each phase. The actual values will be conveyed by one subproperty per alternating current phase: L1, L2 and L3
Attribute description.21: Fundamental frequency reactive power. The actual values will be conveyed by subproperties whose names will be equal to the name of each of the alternating current phases: L1, L2, L3.
Attribute description.22: list of uri pointing to additional resources about the item
Attribute description.23: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

Attribute description.26: Total reactive power for all phases.
Attribute description.27: NGSI Entity type. It has to be SolarEnergy
Attribute description.28: The value of Voltage in the entity corresponding to this observation.

Attribute description.8: Maximum values for the reported period. Subattributes:- temperature : Maximum temperature. See WeatherForecast.temperature for description and units. - feelLikesTemperature. Maximum feels like temperature. Same semantics and units as WeatherForecast.feelsLikeTemperature.- relativeHumidity. Maximum relative humidity. Same semantics and units as WeatherForecast.relativeHumidity.
Attribute description.9: Minimum values forecasted for the reported period. Minimum values for the reported period. Subattributes:- temperature : Minimum temperature. See WeatherForecast.temperature for description and units. - feelLikesTemperature. Minimum feels like temperature. Same semantics and units as WeatherForecast.feelsLikeTemperature.- relativeHumidity. Minimum relative humidity. Same semantics and units as WeatherForecast.relativeHumidity

Attribute description.28: Includes the validity period for this forecast as a ISO8601 time interval. As a workaround for the lack of support of Orion Context Broker for datetime intervals, it can be used two separate attributes: validFrom, validTo.
